alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 10:43PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Gibson and Pike Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 942 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Winslow to 8 miles west of Petersburg. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oakland City and Winslow. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 32 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southwestern Indiana.
